root_causes: Per-cell range check incorrectly treats missing cells as range errors (the script flags missing(x) as an error). With NotRequired=true missing is allowed and should not be counted as a range error.

Open-ended/Other (OE) handling targets the wrong code/variable: the script checks B5cx1_98_other as the OE text and treats B5cx1_98 as the OE code, but the expected 'Other' option is code 9 (B5cx1_9) â€” the OE text variable should be B5cx1_9_other (or whatever the actual OE suffix is).
OE presence test uses not missing(B5cx1_98) rather than checking for a positive/selected numeric (e.g. B5cx1_9 > 0). This can misidentify unselected (0) cells as answered.

The condition used to decide whether to run the AutoSum validation differs from the expected logic: the generated script runs validate when B5cDKx1 = 0 OR missing, whereas the expected logic runs validate only when there is no DK selected (f('B5cDKx1').size() == 0). The SPSS check should mirror 'no DK selected' exactly (usually missing(B5cDKx1) or the correct 'not selected' code), not assume =0 is equivalent.
instructions: Fix per-cell range validation: only flag range errors when a cell is present. Replace the current check 'if (S7_1 > 0 and (missing(x) or x < 0 or x > 999))' with 'if (S7_1 > 0 and not missing(x) and (x < 0 or x > 999))'. This preserves NotRequired behavior (missing allowed).

Correct OE handling to use the actual 'Other' option code/variable. Use B5cx1_9 (not B5cx1_98) as the OE indicator and B5cx1_9_other (or the actual OE text variable) for the free-text. Example: if (S7_1 > 0 and B5cx1_9 > 0 and (missing(B5cx1_9_other) or trim(B5cx1_9_other) = '')) oe_text_err_B5cx1 = 1. And if (S7_1 > 0 and (missing(B5cx1_9) or B5cx1_9 = 0) and not missing(B5cx1_9_other) and trim(B5cx1_9_other) <> '') oe_text_err_B5cx1 = 1.

When testing whether any numeric answer exists, keep using a >0 check if the meaning of 'answered' is positive counts; but ensure that OE/other detection and sum inclusion are consistent: include only the intended numeric sub-variables in the sum (confirm which codes are numeric inputs and which are pure select/OE flags).

Adjust logic that decides whether to run the AutoSum (validateB1c) to match expected semantics. Use 'if (QuestionErrors_B5cx1 = 0 and missing(B5cDKx1))' (or the precise condition that indicates no DK selected in your dataset) before comparing rounded sum to S7_1. Do not treat B5cDKx1 = 0 as equivalent to 'no DK variable selected' unless that is the correct encoding in this dataset.

Review and confirm the list of variables included in the sum and lists shown to the user; ensure B5cx1_9 (Other) is included as a numeric input if intended, and that the OE text variable name matches the actual dataset naming convention. Update all references (list outputs, clean-up delete variables) accordingly.

root_causes: The DO REPEAT and SUM use the range B5cx1_1 TO B5cx1_56 which omits the sub-question variable B5cx1_98 (Answer Code 98). As a result, per-cell validations and the AutoSum omit that item.

The script flags any missing cell as an error when the column is shown and DK is not selected. The expected logic (NotRequired = true and the provided ValidationCode) indicates individual cells should not be forced present; requiredness/consistency should be handled via CheckDK3D and validateB1c (AutoSum) rather than unconditional per-cell missing checks.
OE (Other) check uses B5cx1_9_other; the expected metadata does not explicitly give the OE variable name. If the actual OE variable name differs, the OE presence check will be incorrect.
instructions: Include all actual sub-question variables when iterating and summing. Do not rely on B5cx1_1 TO B5cx1_56 only; explicitly include B5cx1_98 (and any other non-sequential suffixes). For example, use an explicit DO REPEAT list or include B5cx1_98 in the SUM: SUM(B5cx1_1 TO B5cx1_56, B5cx1_98).

Remove or relax the unconditional per-cell missing check. Instead: (a) perform range checks only for non-missing cells (i.e., flag values outside 0..999), and (b) implement requiredness/consistency via the DK check (CheckDK3D semantics) and validateB1c-style AutoSum enforcement. Concretely, change the cell-level IF that sets B5cx1_flag_cell so it does NOT treat MISSING(v) as an immediate error; only treat non-missing values outside 0..999 as out-of-range.

Ensure DK handling mirrors CheckDK3D('B5cx1','B5cDKx1'): if B5cDKx1 indicates DK selected then numeric cells must be missing (flag if present); if DK not selected then run the AutoSum validation (validateB1c) to enforce totals and any required presence implied by that routine. If there is an existing validateB1c routine, call it (or replicate its logic) rather than enforcing per-cell presence prior to sum validation.

Verify and use the correct open-text variable name for the 'Other' response (B5cx1_9's OE). If the real OE field name differs from B5cx1_9_other, update the OE consistency check to reference the actual variable. Ensure the OE check only runs when column is shown and DK is not selected.

Explicitly handle special codes if project conventions require (97/98/99). If these are intended to be allowed/exempt values, either ensure they fall within the numeric allowance or add explicit conditions to accept them (e.g., treat 97/98/99 as allowed non-error values).
